title: Limit docstring length
body_html:
Some docstrings are too long and it produces ugly formatting in Jupyter:

Their length should be restricted to 80 characters (or according to the standard only to 72 characters, Numpy uses 75 characters limit). The first step could be adding such reminder to CONTRIBUTING.md.
body_text:
Some docstrings are too long and it produces ugly formatting in Jupyter:

Their length should be restricted to 80 characters (or according to the standard only to 72  characters, Numpy uses 75 characters limit). The first step could be adding such reminder to CONTRIBUTING.md.
body:
Some docstrings are too long and it produces ugly formatting in Jupyter:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13369474/27448105-2a7b14ba-578c-11e7-8931-02c6696ccdb7.png)
Their length should be restricted to 80 characters (or according to [the standard](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0008/#maximum-line-length) only to 72  characters, [Numpy](https://github.com/numpy/numpy/blob/master/doc/HOWTO_DOCUMENT.rst.txt) uses 75 characters limit). The first step could be adding such reminder to `CONTRIBUTING.md`.
